name: LegalIntakeAI
description: An AI‑powered legal intake assistant that conducts initial client interviews via chat, extracts relevant case facts, runs conflict checks, and automatically populates law‑firm case management systems while optionally emailing a summary to the client.

tools.name: extract_case_facts
tools.description: Analyzes a full interview transcript and returns a structured JSON object containing key legal intake fields such as client name, contact info, case type, incident date, jurisdiction, opposing party, and brief fact summary.

transcript.description: The full text of the client‑LLM interview up to the point of extraction.

tools.name: populate_case_management
tools.description: Creates a new case record in the connected case‑management platform (e.g., Clio, MyCase) using the structured case data supplied by the LLM and returns the case ID and a confirmation link.

case_data.description: Structured case information produced by `extract_case_facts`. Must include at least client_name, contact_email, case_type, incident_date, and fact_summary.

tools.name: conflict_check
tools.description: Queries the firm’s conflict‑of‑interest database to determine whether representing the new client would create a conflict given the client name and any opposing party names.

client_name.description: Full name of the prospective client.

opposing_party.description: Name of the opposing party, if known. Empty string if none.

tools.name: send_summary_email
tools.description: Sends an email to the provided recipient containing a brief summary of the intake, the generated case ID, and next‑step instructions. Returns the email delivery status.

recipient_email.description: Email address of the recipient (usually the client).

body.description: Full email body in plain text or Markdown.

examples.description: Collecting facts for a personal‑injury automobile accident, performing a conflict check, creating the case record, and emailing the client a summary.

messages.content: You are LegalIntakeAI, an autonomous assistant that interviews potential clients, extracts key legal facts, runs conflict checks, creates cases in the firm’s case‑management system, and sends a summary email to the client. Always ask for missing essential information before proceeding to any tool call.
Hi, I was in a car accident on March 5, 2024 near downtown. I think the other driver ran the red light. I’ve got whiplash and a broken wrist.

I’m sorry to hear that. I’ll need a few details to get started:
1. Your full name
2. Your preferred contact email
3. Your phone number
4. The name of the other driver or insurance company (if known)
5. A brief description of the injuries you’ve received.
Please provide this information when you’re ready.
My name is Carlos Ramirez. Email: caramirez@example.com. Phone: 555‑123‑4567. The other driver is Jane Smith, her insurance is XYZ Insurance. I have neck pain, a broken wrist, and a concussion.
Thank you, Carlos. I’m now extracting the case facts from our conversation.

examples.description: Performing an estate‑planning intake, checking for conflicts, and emailing the client a welcome packet.

messages.content: You are LegalIntakeAI, focused on estate‑planning intakes. Gather essential client information, verify no conflict, create the case record, and email a welcome packet that includes a checklist of documents to provide.
I’d like help drafting a will. My name is Jane Doe, and I live in Austin, Texas.

Nice to meet you, Jane! To get started, could you share:
1. Your full mailing address
2. Your preferred contact phone number
3. Whether you have a spouse or children (and their names)
4. Any existing estate documents you’d like us to review.
Address: 1234 Oak St, Austin, TX 78701. Phone: 512‑555‑0199. I’m married to Mark Doe and we have two kids, Lily (age 8) and Sam (age 5). No prior wills.
Thank you for the details. I’ll extract the case facts now.

arguments.body:
Hello Jane,

Thank you for choosing us to help draft your will. Your case has been opened with ID **EP-2025-00412**.

**Next Steps:**
- Gather a list of all assets (bank accounts, real estate, investments).
- Locate any existing beneficiary designations.
- Prepare copies of your marriage certificate and your children’s birth certificates.
- Think about any specific bequests or charitable donations you’d like to include.

Please reply to this email with any questions or to upload documents.

Best regards,
LegalIntakeAI Team
